sen.j: 足利 義輝（あしかが よしてる）は、室町幕府の第13代征夷大将軍（在位：天文_(元号)15年（1546年） - 永禄8年（1565年））。
sen.e: Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA was the 13th Seii Taishogunn (reigned 1546-1565) of the Muromachi Shogunate.
Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA was the 13th Seii Taishogunn (reigned 1546-1565) of the Muromachi Shogunate.
Yoshiteru ASHIKAGA was the 13th Seii Taishogunn (reigned 1546-1565) of the Muromachi Shogunate.

sen.j: 父は第12代将軍の足利義晴。
sen.e: His father was the 12th shogun, Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA.
His father was the 12th shogun, Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA.
His father was the 12th shogun, Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA.

sen.j: なお、第10代将軍足利義稙の養子となった阿波公方足利義維は叔父で、その子である第14代将軍・足利義栄は従兄弟にあたる。
sen.e: His uncle was Yoshituna ASHIKAGA, the Awa kubo and also an adopted son of the 10th shogun Yoshitane ASHIKAGA, and his cousin Yoshihide ASHIKAGA, the 14th shogun, was a son of Yoshitsuna.
His uncle was Yoshitsuna ASHIKAGA, who was the Awa Kubo and also an adopted son of the 10th shogun Yoshitane ASHIKAGA, and his cousin Yoshihide ASHIKAGA, the 14th shogun, was a son of Yoshitsuna.
sen.cmt: Yoshituna->Yoshitsuna; Awa kubo -> Awa Kubo; added "who was" for clarity
sen.e: His uncle was Yoshitsuna ASHIKAGA, who was the Awa Kubo and also an adopted son of the 10th shogun Yoshitane ASHIKAGA, and his cousin Yoshihide ASHIKAGA, the 14th shogun, was a son of Yoshitsuna.

sen.j: 天文5年（1536年）3月10日、第12代将軍・足利義晴の嫡男として東山南禅寺で生まれる。
sen.e: On March 10th, 1536 (Tenbun 5), Yoshiteru was born to the 12th shogun Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA as his first son in the Nanzen-ji Temple in Higashiyama.
On March 10th, 1536 (Tenbun 5), Yoshiteru was born to the 12th shogun Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA as his first son in the Nanzen-ji Temple in Higashiyama.
On March 10th, 1536 (Tenbun 5), Yoshiteru was born to the 12th shogun Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA as his first son in the Nanzen-ji Temple in Higashiyama.

sen.j: この頃の幕府では父・義晴と管領・細川晴元が対立し、義晴はそのたびに敗れて近江国坂本に逃れ、それに義輝もたびたび従った。
sen.e: In those days there was a conflict between his father Yoshiharu and the Kanrei (shogun's deputy) Harumoto HOSOKAWA, and every time Yoshiharu lost the battles against Harumoto, he fled to Sakamoto, Omi Province taking his son Yoshiteru with him.
sen.cmt: 近江国の対訳からOmi no Kuniを削除。管領について：これより後に出てくる訳語には（ ）内の補足説明は無し
sen.e: In those days there were conflicts between his father Yoshiharu and the Kanrei (shogun's deputy) Harumoto HOSOKAWA, and every time Yoshiharu lost to Harumoto, he fled to Sakamoto, Omi Province, taking his son Yoshiteru with him.
sen.cmt: number matching between "conflicts" and "every time"; deleted "battles" as unnecessary, and not stated in original; punctuation around "Omi Province"
sen.e: In those days there were conflicts between his father Yoshiharu and the Kanrei (shogun's deputy) Harumoto HOSOKAWA, and every time Yoshiharu lost to Harumoto, he fled to Sakamoto, Omi Province, taking his son Yoshiteru with him.

sen.j: その後も父とともに京への復帰と坂本への脱出を繰り返した。
sen.e: Even in later years the father and son went back and forth between Kyoto and Sakamoto.
Even in later years the father and son went back and forth between Kyoto and Sakamoto.
Even in later years the father and son went back and forth between Kyoto and Sakamoto.

sen.j: 天文15年（1546年）12月、義輝はわずか11歳にして、父から将軍職を譲られる。
sen.e: In December, 1546, Yoshiteru succeeded to his father and became the shogun at only 11 years of age.
In December, 1546, Yoshiteru succeeded his father and became the shogun at only 11 years of age.
sen.cmt: deleted "to" (appropriate for 'succeed to [a position]; inappropriate for 'succeed [a person])
sen.e: In December, 1546, Yoshiteru succeeded his father and became the shogun at only 11 years of age.

sen.j: このときの将軍就任式は亡命先の近江坂本で行なわれ、元服の烏帽子親は六角定頼が務めた（初名・義藤）。
sen.e: His investiture ceremony was held at Sakamoto, Omi Province, where he had been banished, and his Eboshi oya Sadayori ROKKAKU gave him the adult name Yoshifuji in his coming-of-age ceremony called Gempuku.
sen.cmt: 元服の対訳表記をGenpukuからGempukuに変更
sen.e: His investiture ceremony was held at Sakamoto, Omi Province, where he had been exiled, and his Eboshi oya Sadayori ROKKAKU gave him the adult name Yoshifuji in his coming-of-age ceremony (Gempuku).
His investiture ceremony was held at Sakamoto, Omi Province, where he had been exiled, and his Eboshi oya Sadayori ROKKAKU gave him the adult name Yoshifuji in his coming-of-age ceremony (Genpuku).

sen.j: 天文17年（1548年）、義晴は細川晴元と和睦して京に戻った。
sen.e: In 1548, his father Yoshiharu was reconciled with Harumoto HOSOKAWA and returned to Kyoto.
In 1548, his father Yoshiharu was reconciled with Harumoto HOSOKAWA and returned to Kyoto.
In 1548, his father Yoshiharu was reconciled with Harumoto HOSOKAWA and returned to Kyoto.

sen.j: このとき晴元も義輝の将軍就任を承諾している。
sen.e: At that time, Harumoto also accepted that Tadateru had become the shogun.
At that time, Harumoto also accepted that Tadateru had become the shogun.
At that time, Harumoto also accepted that Tadateru had become the shogun.

sen.j: ところが、晴元の家臣である三好長慶が晴元を裏切って細川氏綱に味方し、畿内に一大勢力を築き上げた。
sen.e: Harumoto's retainer Nagayoshi (Chokei) MIYOSHI betrayed his lord, and sided with Ujitsuna HOSOKAWA, developing a dominant power in Kinai.
Harumoto's retainer Nagayoshi (Chokei) MIYOSHI betrayed his lord, and sided with Ujitsuna HOSOKAWA, developing a dominant power in Kinai.
Harumoto's retainer Nagayoshi (Chokei) MIYOSHI betrayed his lord, and sided with Ujitsuna HOSOKAWA, developing a dominant power in Kinai.

sen.j: このため、足利義晴・義輝父子は細川晴元とともに京都を再び追われて近江に逃亡した。
sen.e: Because of this, Yoshiharu and Yoshiteru were driven out from Kyoto to Omi Province along with Harumoto HOSOKAWA.
Because of this, Yoshiharu and Yoshiteru were driven out from Kyoto to Omi Province along with Harumoto HOSOKAWA.
Because of this, Yoshiharu and Yoshiteru were driven out from Kyoto to Omi Province along with Harumoto HOSOKAWA.

sen.j: そしてその最中の天文19年（1550年）、義晴は近江坂本にて死去している。
sen.e: In 1550 (Tenbun 21), Yoshiharu died in exile at Sakamoto.
In 1550, Yoshiharu died in exile at Sakamoto.
In 1550, Yoshiharu died in exile at Sakamoto.

sen.j: 天文21年（1552年）、氏綱を管領にするという条件で三好長慶と和睦し、京に戻った。
sen.e: In 1552, Yoshiteru was reconciled with Nagayoshi (Chokei) and could return to Kyoto under the condition that he would appoint Ujitsuna the position of Kanrei.
In 1552, Yoshiteru was reconciled with Nagayoshi (Chokei) and was able to return to Kyoto under the condition that he appoint Ujitsuna the position of Kanrei.
In 1552, Yoshiteru was reconciled with Nagayoshi (Chokei) and was able to return to Kyoto under the condition that he appoint Ujitsuna the position of Kanrei.

sen.j: 翌年から細川晴元と協力して長慶との戦いを始める。
sen.e: The following year he began to fight against Nagayoshi with Harumoto HOSOKAWA.
The following year he began to fight against Nagayoshi with Harumoto HOSOKAWA.
The following year he began to fight against Nagayoshi with Harumoto HOSOKAWA.

sen.j: しかし敗れて近江坂本に逃れた。
sen.e: However, they lost at the battle and fled to Sakamoto, Omi Province.
However, they lost at the battle and fled to Sakamoto, Omi Province.
However, they lost at the battle and fled to Sakamoto, Omi Province.

sen.j: 永禄元年（1558年）、長慶と和睦して京に戻る。
sen.e: In 1558, Yoshiteru was reconciled with Nagayoshi (Chokei) and returned to Kyoto.
In 1558, Yoshiteru was reconciled with Nagayoshi (Chokei) and returned to Kyoto.
In 1558, Yoshiteru was reconciled with Nagayoshi (Chokei) and returned to Kyoto.

sen.j: ところがその直後、再び長慶と戦う。
sen.e: Soon after that, he fought against Nagayoshi again.
Soon after that, he fought against Nagayoshi again.
Soon after that, he fought against Nagayoshi again.

sen.j: 一時期は六角義賢の支援を受けた義輝側が優勢であったが、三好長慶の弟・三好義賢の猛反攻を受け、さらに六角義賢からも支援を打ち切られたため、遂に京から追われた。
sen.e: With Yoshikata ROKKAKU's help, Yoshiteru temporarily overwhelmed Nagayoshi (chokei), but Nagayoshi's (chokei's) younger brother Yoshikata MIYOSHI fiercely attacked Yoshiteru's army, so Yoshiteru was driven out of Kyoto losing Yoshikata ROKKAKU's support.

With Yoshikata ROKKAKU's help, Yoshiteru temporarily overwhelmed Nagayoshi (chokei), but Nagayoshi's (chokei's) younger brother Yoshikata MIYOSHI fiercely attacked Yoshiteru's army, so Yoshiteru was driven out of Kyoto losing Yoshikata ROKKAKU's support.

With Yoshikata ROKKAKU's help, Yoshiteru temporarily overwhelmed Nagayoshi (chokei), but Nagayoshi's (chokei's) younger brother Yoshikata MIYOSHI fiercely attacked Yoshiteru's army, so Yoshiteru was driven out of Kyoto losing Yoshikata ROKKAKU's support.

sen.j: しかし、長慶は将軍殺しの汚名を着せられることを嫌い、戦いに勝利した後、和睦を申し出ている。
sen.e: However, Nagayoshi (chokei) tried to avoid getting a bad reputation as a murderer of the shogun, so he attempted a reconciliation with Yoshiteru.
However, Nagayoshi (chokei) attempted a reconciliation with Yoshiteru to avoid getting a bad reputation as a murderer of the shogun.
However, Nagayoshi (chokei) attempted a reconciliation with Yoshiteru to avoid getting a bad reputation as a murderer of the shogun.

sen.j: これにより京に戻ることはできたが、長慶は幕府の御相伴衆に加えられ、さらに修理大夫に推挙され、幕政の実権を握った。
sen.e: Because of this Yoshiteru could return to Kyoto, but Ngayoshi (Chokei) held power over the government, being assigned to the positions of Oshobanshu and Shuri daibu.
Because of this Yoshiteru could return to Kyoto, but Nagayoshi (Chokei) held power over the government, being assigned to the positions of Oshobanshu and Shuri daibu.
Because of this Yoshiteru could return to Kyoto, but Nagayoshi (Chokei) held power over the government, being assigned to the positions of Oshobanshu and Shuri daibu.

sen.j: 義輝は単なる長慶の傀儡にすぎなかった。
sen.e: Yoshiteru was just a puppet.
Yoshiteru was just a puppet.
Yoshiteru was just a puppet.

sen.j: 長慶はたびたび暗殺未遂事件に遭遇しているが、義輝の差し金であったとされる。
sen.e: Nagayoshi (Chokei) had survived several assassination attempts, which seems to have been plotted by Yoshiteru.
Nagayoshi (Chokei) had survived several assassination attempts, which seem to have been plotted by Yoshiteru.
Nagayoshi (Chokei) had survived several assassination attempts, which seem to have been plotted by Yoshiteru.

tit.e: Political activity by the shogun Yoshiteru
Political Activity by the Shogun Yoshiteru
Political Activity by the Shogun Yoshiteru

sen.j: 幕府権力と将軍権威の復活を目指して、精力的な政治活動を行なっている。
sen.e: Yoshiteru acted vigorously to retrieve the power of the shogunate and the authority of the shogun.
Yoshiteru acted vigorously to restore the power of the shogunate and the authority of the shogun.
Yoshiteru acted vigorously to restore the power of the shogunate and the authority of the shogun.

sen.j: 伊達晴宗と伊達稙宗（天文17年（1548年））、武田信玄と上杉謙信（永禄元年（1558年））、島津貴久と大友義鎮、毛利元就と尼子晴久（永禄3年（1560年））などの抗争の調停を頻繁に行なって、諸大名に将軍の存在を知らしめたのである。
sen.e: By his mediating between such well known daimyo as Harumune DATE and Tanemune DATE (in 1548), Shingen TAKEDA and Kenshin UESUGI (in 1558), Takahisa SHIMAZU and Yoshishige OTOMO, Motonari MORI and Haruhisa AMAGO (in 1560), the shogun's authority was recognized by various daimyo.

By his mediating between such well known daimyo as Harumune DATE and Tanemune DATE (in 1548), Shingen TAKEDA and Kenshin UESUGI (in 1558), Takahisa SHIMAZU and Yoshishige OTOMO, and Motonari MORI and Haruhisa AMAGO (in 1560), the shogun's authority was recognized by various daimyo.

By his mediating between such well known daimyo as Harumune DATE and Tanemune DATE (in 1548), Shingen TAKEDA and Kenshin UESUGI (in 1558), Takahisa SHIMAZU and Yoshishige OTOMO, and Motonari MORI and Haruhisa AMAGO (in 1560), the shogun's authority was recognized by various daimyo.

sen.j: さらに自分の名である『輝』の字を毛利輝元や伊達輝宗･上杉謙信（上杉輝虎）などの諸大名や足利一門の足利輝氏などに与えたりもしている（前名の『藤』は細川幽斎（出家して細川幽斎）や足利藤氏、筒井順慶（出家して筒井順慶）などに与えている）。
sen.e: In addition to that, he also gave the letter (輝) in his given name to various daimyo like Terumoto MORI (毛利輝元), Terumune DATE (伊達輝宗), Kenshin UESUGI (Terutora UESUKI (上杉輝虎)) and Teruuji ASHIKAGA(足利輝氏), who was one of the Ashikaga clan. (The letter (藤) in his previous name (義藤) was also assigned to the people such as Yusai HOSOKAWA (Buddhist name), Fujiuji AHIKAGA (足利藤氏), Junkei TSUTSUI (Buddhist name).

In addition to that, he also gave the letter (輝) in his given name to various daimyo like Terumoto MORI (毛利輝元), Terumune DATE (伊達輝宗), Kenshin UESUGI (Terutora UESUKI (上杉輝虎)) and Teruuji ASHIKAGA(足利輝氏), who was one of the Ashikaga clan. (The letter (藤) in his previous name (義藤) was also assigned to the people such as Yusai HOSOKAWA (Buddhist name), Fujiuji AHIKAGA (足利藤氏), Junkei TSUTSUI (Buddhist name).

In addition to that, he also gave the letter (輝) in his given name to various daimyo like Terumoto MORI (毛利輝元), Terumune DATE (伊達輝宗), Kenshin UESUGI (Terutora UESUGI (上杉輝虎)) and Teruuji ASHIKAGA(足利輝氏), who was one of the Ashikaga clan. (The letter (藤) in his previous name (義藤) was also assigned to the people such as Yusai HOSOKAWA (Buddhist name), Fujiuji AHIKAGA (足利藤氏), Junkei TSUTSUI (Buddhist name).

sen.j: このような経緯から、将軍として諸大名から認められるようになり、織田信長や上杉謙信などは上洛して拝謁、大友義鎮は鉄砲を献上している。
sen.e: This is how he came to be recognized as the shogun by the various daimyo, and Nobunaga ODA and Kenshin UESUGI traveled to Kyoto to have an audience with him, while Yoshishige OTOMO presented some rifles to him.

This is how he came to be recognized as the shogun by the various daimyo, and Nobunaga ODA and Kenshin UESUGI traveled to Kyoto to have an audience with him, while Yoshishige OTOMO presented some rifles to him.

This is how he came to be recognized as the shogun by the various daimyo, and Nobunaga ODA and Kenshin UESUGI traveled to Kyoto to have an audience with him, while Yoshishige OTOMO presented some rifles to him.

sen.j: 永禄元年（1558年）の義輝の帰京以降も長慶の権勢は続いたが、それに反発する畠山高政と六角義賢は畿内で蜂起し、三好氏は三好義賢が戦死するなど衰退の兆しが見え始めた。
sen.e: Nagayoshi still had his power after Yoshiteru returned to Kyoto in 1558, but Takamasa HATAKEYAMA and Yoshitaka ROKKAKU revolted against Nagayoshi (Chokei) at Kinai, and the death of Yoshitaka MIYOSHI was one example of the Miyoshi clan's declining.

Nagayoshi still had his power after Yoshiteru returned to Kyoto in 1558, but Takamasa HATAKEYAMA and Yoshitaka ROKKAKU revolted against Nagayoshi (Chokei) at Kinai, and the death of Yoshitaka MIYOSHI was one example of the Miyoshi clan's decline.

Nagayoshi still had his power after Yoshiteru returned to Kyoto in 1558, but Takamasa HATAKEYAMA and Yoshitaka ROKKAKU revolted against Nagayoshi (Chokei) at Kinai, and the death of Yoshitaka MIYOSHI was one example of the Miyoshi clan's decline.

sen.j: こうした中、永禄5年（1562年）には、長慶と手を結び幕政を壟断していた旧政所執事の伊勢貞孝が失脚し、反乱を起こすも長慶の手で討たれた。
sen.e: Under these conditions, Sadataka ISE, who had occupied power over the shogunate with Nagayoshi (Chokei), lost his position of the regent of the old Mandokoro and rose in revolt only to be defeated by Nagayoshi (Chokei).
sen.cmt: 政所執事の対訳をMandokoro shitsujiからregent of the Mandokoroに変更
sen.e: Under these conditions, Sadataka ISE, who had held power over the shogunate with Nagayoshi (Chokei), lost his position as regent of the old Mandokoro and rose in revolt only to be defeated by Nagayoshi (Chokei).

Under these conditions, Sadataka ISE, who had held power over the shogunate with Nagayoshi (Chokei), lost his position as regent of the old Mandokoro and rose in revolt only to be defeated by Nagayoshi (Chokei).

sen.j: さらに、永禄7年（1564年）には、長慶自身が病死した。
sen.e: And then Nagayoshi (Chokei) died of disease in 1564 (Eiroku 7).
And then Nagayoshi (Chokei) died of disease in 1564.
And then Nagayoshi (Chokei) died of disease in 1564.

sen.j: 政敵が消滅した義輝は、いよいよ幕府権力の復活に向けてさらなる政治活動を行なおうとした。
sen.e: Since his political rival was gone, Yoshiteru tried to act more vigorously to retrieve the power of the shogunate.
Since his political rival was gone, Yoshiteru tried to act more vigorously to restore the power of the shogunate.
Since his political rival was gone, Yoshiteru tried to act more vigorously to restore the power of the shogunate.

sen.j: しかし、長慶の死後に幕政を牛耳ろうと目論んでいた松永久秀と三好三人衆にとっては、そのような義輝は邪魔な存在であったため、久秀と三人衆は足利義稙の養子・足利義維と組み、義輝を排除して、義維の嫡男・足利義栄（義輝の従兄弟）を傀儡として擁立する。
sen.e: However, Hisahide MATSUNAGA and the Miyoshi Triumvirate, who tried to occupy the shogunate after Nagayoshi's (Chokei's) death, considered that Yoshiteru was their enemy. So they cooperated with Yoshitsuna ASHIKAGA, an adopted son of Yoshitane ASHIKAGA, and set Yoshitsuna's heir Yoshihide ASHIKAGA (Yoshiteru's cousin) as a puppet prospective shogun, excluding Yoshiteru.
sen.cmt: 三好三人衆の対訳Miyoshi sanninshuからMiyoshi Triumvirateに変更
sen.e: However, Hisahide MATSUNAGA and the Miyoshi Triumvirate, who tried to occupy the shogunate after Nagayoshi's (Chokei's) death, considered Yoshiteru their enemy. So they cooperated with Yoshitsuna ASHIKAGA, an adopted son of Yoshitane ASHIKAGA, and set up Yoshitsuna's heir, Yoshihide ASHIKAGA (Yoshiteru's cousin), as a puppet prospective shogun, excluding Yoshiteru.

However, Hisahide MATSUNAGA and the Miyoshi Triumvirate, who tried to occupy the shogunate after Nagayoshi's (Chokei's) death, considered Yoshiteru their enemy. So they cooperated with Yoshitsuna ASHIKAGA, an adopted son of Yoshitane ASHIKAGA, and set up Yoshitsuna's heir, Yoshihide ASHIKAGA (Yoshiteru's cousin), as a puppet prospective shogun, excluding Yoshiteru.

sen.j: 一方で義輝が頼みとする近江六角氏は永禄6年（1563年）の観音寺騒動により力を失っていた。
sen.e: On the other hand, the Rokkaku clan on whom Yoshiteru had depended lost its power because of the Kannon-ji Disturbance in 1563.
sen.cmt: 観音寺騒動の対訳をKannon-ji sodoからKannon-ji Disturbanceに変更
sen.e: On the other hand, the Rokkaku clan on whom Yoshiteru had depended lost its power because of the Kannon-ji Disturbance in 1563.
On the other hand, the Rokkaku clan on whom Yoshiteru had depended lost its power because of the Kannon-ji Disturbance in 1563.

sen.j: そして、永禄8年（1565年）5月19日、久秀と三好三人衆は主君・三好義継（長慶の養嗣子）とともに足利義栄を奉じて謀叛を起こした（永禄の変）。
sen.e: And then on May 19th, 1565 (Eiroku 8), Hisahide and the Miyoshi Triumvirate revolted against Yoshiteru with their lord Yoshitsugu MIYOSHI (Nagayoshi's (Chokei's) adopted heir), setting Yoshihide ASHIKAGA as their puppet leader. (Eiroku no Hen)

And then on May 19th, 1565, Hisahide and the Miyoshi Triumvirate revolted against Yoshiteru with their lord Yoshitsugu MIYOSHI (Nagayoshi's (Chokei's) adopted heir), setting up Yoshihide ASHIKAGA as their puppet leader (Eiroku no Hen).
sen.cmt: deleted Japanese date; added "up"; moved period
sen.e: And then on May 19th, 1565, Hisahide and the Miyoshi Triumvirate revolted against Yoshiteru with their lord Yoshitsugu MIYOSHI (Nagayoshi's (Chokei's) adopted heir), setting up Yoshihide ASHIKAGA as their puppet leader (Eiroku no Hen).

sen.j: 義輝の居城である二条御所に軍勢を率いて襲撃したのである。
sen.e: They led an army against the castle called Nijo Gosho, where Yoshiteru had lived.
sen.cmt: 二条御所の対訳からNijo Castle（二条城）を削除
sen.e: They led an army against the castle called Nijo Gosho, where Yoshiteru had lived.
They led an army against the castle called Nijo Gosho, where Yoshiteru had lived.

sen.j: 義輝は上泉信綱に教えを受け、塚原卜伝に奥義の伝授を受けた剣豪であったため、秘蔵の太刀をもって敵兵を多数斬り殺したという。
sen.e: Yoshiteru was a great swordsman who was instructed by Nobutsuna KAMIIZUMI and initiated into the esoteric point of swordsmanship by Bokuden TSUKAHARA. So it is said that he killed many enemies with his treasurable sword.

Yoshiteru was a great swordsman who was instructed by Nobutsuna KAMIIZUMI and initiated into the esoteric points of swordsmanship by Bokuden TSUKAHARA. So it is said that he killed many enemies with his treasured sword.

Yoshiteru was a great swordsman who was instructed by Nobutsuna KAMIIZUMI and initiated into the esoteric points of swordsmanship by Bokuden TSUKAHARA. So it is said that he killed many enemies with his treasured sword.

sen.j: しかし、衆寡敵せず、最後は三好勢によって殺害される。
sen.e: However, the odds were against those who fought in small numbers, and eventually Yoshiteru was killed by the Miyoshi's forces.
However, the odds were against those who fought in small numbers, and eventually Yoshiteru was killed by the Miyoshi's forces.
However, the odds were against those who fought in small numbers, and eventually Yoshiteru was killed by the Miyoshi's forces.

sen.j: 享年30（満29歳没）。
sen.e: His age at death: 30 (according to the East Asian age reckoning, and 29 by the regular way of counting)
His age at death: 30 (according to the East Asian age reckoning, and 29 by the regular way of counting)
His age at death: 30 (according to the East Asian age reckoning, and 29 by the regular way of counting)

sen.j: （ルイス・フロイスの『日本史』にも奮戦の様子が記されているほか、「言継卿記」には自害したと記される）。
sen.e: ("Historia de Iapam (History of Japan)" written by Luis Frois describes Yoshiteru's struggle in his fight, and "Tokitsugu kyoki" says that Yoshiteru killed himself.)
("Historia de Iapam (History of Japan)" written by Luis Frois describes Yoshiteru's struggle in his fight, and "Tokitsugu kyoki" says that Yoshiteru killed himself.)
("Historia de Iapam (History of Japan)" written by Luis Frois describes Yoshiteru's struggle in his fight, and "Tokitsugu kyoki" says that Yoshiteru killed himself.)

sen.j: このとき、義輝の生母である慶寿院も殉死している。
sen.e: At about the same time, Yoshiteru's mother Kijuin killed herself on the death of her son.
At about the same time, Yoshiteru's mother Kijuin killed herself on the death of her son.
At about the same time, Yoshiteru's mother Kijuin killed herself on the death of her son.

sen.j: 五月雨は 露か涙か 不如帰 我が名をあげよ 雲の上まで
sen.e: An early summer rain,but are they raindrops or my tears?A cuckoo, pleasefly up into the sky and go above the clouds taking my name with you.
An early summer rain,but are they raindrops or my tears?A cuckoo, pleasefly up into the sky and go above the clouds taking my name with you.
An early summer rain,but are they raindrops or my tears?A cuckoo, pleasefly up into the sky and go above the clouds taking my name with you.

sen.j: 塚原卜伝からの指導を受け、鎌倉から江戸までの征夷大将軍の中でも、最も武術の優れた人物として伝えられている。
sen.e: Instructed by Bokuden TSUKAHARA, Yoshiteru was said to be the most skillful swordsman among the Seii Taishogun between the Kamakura period to the Edo period.
Instructed by Bokuden TSUKAHARA, Yoshiteru was said to be the most skillful swordsman among the Seii Taishogun between the Kamakura period and the Edo period.
Instructed by Bokuden TSUKAHARA, Yoshiteru was said to be the most skillful swordsman among the Seii Taishogun between the Kamakura period and the Edo period.

sen.j: 松永久秀らの二条御所襲撃の際も刀を数本畳にさし、刃こぼれしては新しい刀に替えて敵を切り伏せ続けたという。
sen.e: It is said that when he was attacked by Hisahide MATSUNAGA at the castle called Nijo Gosho, he thrust several swords into the tatami mat, and every time his sword was broken, he took up the new one and kept killing his enemies.

It is said that when he was attacked by Hisahide MATSUNAGA at the castle called Nijo Gosho, he thrust several swords into the tatami mat, and every time his sword was broken, he took up a new one and kept killing his enemies.

It is said that when he was attacked by Hisahide MATSUNAGA at the castle called Nijo Gosho, he thrust several swords into the tatami mat, and every time his sword was broken, he took up a new one and kept killing his enemies.

sen.j: このため、現代において「剣豪」「剣聖将軍」と称される場合もある。
sen.e: That is why today he is sometimes called "Kengo" or "Kensi Shogun", which means the great swordsman.
sen.cmt: 剣豪の対訳からthe great swordman削除
sen.e: That is why today he is sometimes called "Kengo" or "Kensi Shogun", which means the great swordsman.
That is why today he is sometimes called "Kengo" or "Kensi Shogun", which means the great swordsman.

sen.j: 室町幕府の歴代将軍の中でも特に覇気に溢れ、武士らしい将軍と讃えられている。
sen.e: People admired him for his high morale among all the past shogun of the Muromachi period, and called him the real samurai.
People admired him for his high morale among all the past shogun of the Muromachi period, and called him a real samurai.
People admired him for his high morale among all the past shogun of the Muromachi period, and called him a real samurai.

sen.j: その政治活動により、一時的とはいえ将軍権威が復活したことにおいて、その努力は評価に値する。
sen.e: His achievement of recovering the authority of the shogun, although temporary, is worth appreciating.
His achievement of restoring the authority of the shogun, although temporary, is worth appreciating.
His achievement of restoring the authority of the shogun, although temporary, is worth appreciating.

sen.j: しかしながら実際の統治としては、曲がりなりにも和睦後の将軍権力を軍事力で裏づけしていた三好長慶の暗殺を度々試みるなど、視野の狭さを窺わせる施策が多く見られる。
sen.e: However, his insistent attempts to assassinate Nagayoshi (Chokei) MIYOSHI suggest his narrow view, because after their reconciliation Nagayoshi virtually supported Yoshiteru's power by his army.
However, his insistent attempts to assassinate Nagayoshi (Chokei) MIYOSHI suggest his narrow view, because after their reconciliation Nagayoshi virtually supported Yoshiteru's power by his army.
However, his insistent attempts to assassinate Nagayoshi (Chokei) MIYOSHI suggest his narrow view, because after their reconciliation Nagayoshi virtually supported Yoshiteru's power by his army.

sen.j: 皮肉にも自らが暗殺されたことにより、将軍の権威は地に堕ちた。
sen.e: Ironically, Yoshiteru's assassination led to the fall of the shogun's authority.
Ironically, Yoshiteru's assassination led to the fall of the shogun's authority.
Ironically, Yoshiteru's assassination led to the fall of the shogun's authority.

sen.j: 辞世の句にも、野心と無念が窺える。
sen.e: His death poem implies his ambition and regret.
His death poem implies his ambition and regret.
His death poem implies his ambition and regret.

sen.j: 天文23年（1554年）には大友氏から鉄砲と火薬の秘伝書（『鉄放薬方并調合次第』）を手に入れたり、永禄3年（1560年）にはガスパル・ヴィレラにキリスト教の布教を許すなど、新しい物に目敏かったようだ。
sen.e: In 1554, Yoshiteru got rifles and a secret recipe for making gunpowder called "Teppokusurikata narabini chogo shidai" from the Otomo clan, and in 1560, he allowed Gaspar Vilela to preach Christianity, and these facts illustrate that he had a great interest in something new.

In 1554, Yoshiteru got rifles and a secret recipe for making gunpowder called "Teppokusurikata narabini chogo shidai" from the Otomo clan, and in 1560, he allowed Gaspar Vilela to preach Christianity, and these facts illustrate that he had a great interest in new things.

In 1554, Yoshiteru got rifles and a secret recipe for making gunpowder called "Teppokusurikata narabini chogo shidai" from the Otomo clan, and in 1560, he allowed Gaspar Vilela to preach Christianity, and these facts illustrate that he had a great interest in new things.

sen.j: ただし、これも直前に三好氏がその領国内においてキリスト教の布教の自由を認めていた事に留意すべきである。
sen.e: It should be noted, however, that the Miyoshi clan had approved the Christian missionary work right before Yoshiteru gave them permission.
It should be noted, however, that the Miyoshi clan had approved the Christian missionary work right before Yoshiteru gave them permission.
It should be noted, however, that the Miyoshi clan had approved the Christian missionary work right before Yoshiteru gave them permission.

sen.j: 義輝個人の嗜好と言うよりも、三好氏との対抗上、もしくは三好氏の意向を受けての裁可である可能性が高い。
sen.e: It could be the Miyoshi clan's policy rather than Yoshiteru's own decision because the Miyoshi clan was more powerful than Yoshiteru.
It could be the Miyoshi clan's policy rather than Yoshiteru's own decision because the Miyoshi clan was more powerful than Yoshiteru.
It could be the Miyoshi clan's policy rather than Yoshiteru's own decision because the Miyoshi clan was more powerful than Yoshiteru.

sen.j: 細川藤孝の孫で熊本藩主となった細川忠利は、讃岐国に閑居していた義輝の遺児・尾家義辰（尾池玄蕃）を探し出し熊本に迎えている。
sen.e: Fujitaka HOSOKAWA's grandson and also a lord of Kumamoto Domain, Tadatoshi HOSOKAWA tracked down Yoshiteru's bereaved son Yoshitatsu OIKE (also known as Genba OIKE), who had lived quietly in Sanuki Province, and took him to Kumamoto.
sen.cmt: 熊本藩の対訳からKumamoto-hanを削除。讃岐国の対訳からSanuki no Kuniを削除。名字は尾池が正しいと思われます。
sen.e: Fujitaka HOSOKAWA's grandson and also a lord of Kumamoto Domain, Tadatoshi HOSOKAWA tracked down Yoshiteru's bereaved son Yoshitatsu OIKE (also known as Genba OIKE), who had lived quietly in Sanuki Province, and took him to Kumamoto.

Fujitaka HOSOKAWA's grandson and also a lord of Kumamoto Domain, Tadatoshi HOSOKAWA tracked down Yoshiteru's bereaved son Yoshitatsu OIKE (also known as Genba OIKE), who had lived quietly in Sanuki Province, and took him to Kumamoto.

sen.j: 忠利は、熊本藩の客分・宮本武蔵とともに義辰を山鹿温泉の新築の御茶屋（別荘）に招くなどした。
sen.e: Tadatoshi invited Yoshitatsu to his new villa at Yamaga Onsen along with his guest Musashi MIYAMOTO.
Tadatoshi invited Yoshitatsu to his new villa at Yamaga Onsen along with his guest Musashi MIYAMOTO.
Tadatoshi invited Yoshitatsu to his new villa at Yamaga Onsen along with his guest Musashi MIYAMOTO.

sen.j: 子孫は西山氏を名乗り、知行1000石、比着座同列定席の家格にて明治に至る。
sen.e: Yoshiteru's descendants called themselves the Nishiyama clan, whose size of fief called Chigyo was 1000, and family rank according to the seating position was Hichakuza doretsuteiseki, which lasted to the Meiji period.

Yoshiteru's descendants called themselves the Nishiyama clan, whose fief (Chigyo) was 1000 koku, and whose family rank according to seating position was Hichakuza doretsuteiseki, which lasted to the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: fief called Chigyo->fief (Chigyo); added "koku" unit; deleted "the"
sen.e: Yoshiteru's descendants called themselves the Nishiyama clan, whose fief (Chigyo) was 1000 koku, and whose family rank according to seating position was Hichakuza doretsuteiseki, which lasted to the Meiji period.

sen.j: 他の子としては、義輝暗殺の際に家臣に保護され丹波国の波多野氏の下で養育されたという足利義高（出家して天誉）がいたと伝わる。
sen.e: His other son was Yoshitaka ASHIKAGA (later known as a priest Ten'yo), who was saved by Yoshiteru's vassal when he was killed, and Yoshitaka was taken to Tamba Province and brought up under the Hatano clan.
sen.cmt: 丹波国の対訳からTamba no Kuni削除
sen.e: His other son was Yoshitaka ASHIKAGA (later known as priest Ten'yo), who was saved by Yoshiteru's vassal when he was killed, and Yoshitaka was taken to Tamba Province and brought up under the Hatano clan.

His other son was Yoshitaka ASHIKAGA (later known as priest Ten'yo), who was saved by Yoshiteru's vassal when he was killed, and Yoshitaka was taken to Tanba Province and brought up under the Hatano clan.

tit.e: History of the post and courtly rank Yoshiteru was given
tit.cmt: capitalized words in section heading; simplified for clarity

sen.j: ※ 日付＝旧暦
sen.e: All the following dates are based on the Japanese lunar calendar.
All the following dates are based on the Japanese lunar calendar.
All the following dates are based on the Japanese lunar calendar.
In 1546 (Tenbun 15)

sen.j: 7月27日、従五位下に叙す。
sen.e: On July 27th, he was given the courtly title of the Fifth Rank, Junior Grade.
On July 27th, he was given the courtly title of the Fifth Rank, Junior Grade.
On July 27th, he was given the courtly title of the Fifth Rank, Junior Grade.

sen.j: 11月19日、正五位下に昇叙し、左馬頭に任官。
sen.e: On November 19th, he was upgraded to the upper Fifth Rank and got the title of Sama no kami.
On November 19th, he was upgraded to the Senior Fifth Rank and got the title of Sama no kami.
On November 19th, he was upgraded to the Senior Fifth Rank and got the title of Sama no kami.
sen.cmt: スペースの重複を削除

sen.j: 12月19日、元服し、義藤を名乗る。
sen.e: On December 19th, he was given the adult name (義藤) at his coming-of-age ceremony called Gempuku.
On December 19th, he was given the adult name Yoshifuji at his coming-of-age ceremony (Gempuku).
On December 19th, he was given the adult name Yoshifuji at his coming-of-age ceremony (Genpuku).

sen.j: 12月20日、従四位下征夷大将軍宣下。
sen.e: On December 20th, he was upgraded to the Fourth Rank, Junior Grade, and got the title of Seii Taishogun.
On December 20th, he was upgraded to the Fourth Rank, Junior Grade, and got the title of Seii Taishogun.
On December 20th, he was upgraded to the Fourth Rank, Junior Grade, and got the title of Seii Taishogun.
In 1547 (Tenbun 16)

sen.j: 2月17日、参議に補任し、左近衛中将を兼任。
sen.e: On February 17th, he was assigned Sangi, which meant he could join the politics of the government, and also held the title of Sakonoe Chujo.
On February 17th, he was assigned Sangi, which meant he could join the politics of the government, and also held the title of Sakonoe Chujo.
On February 17th, he was assigned Sangi, which meant he could join the politics of the government, and also held the title of Sakonoe Chujo.
In 1554 (Tenbun 23)

sen.j: 2月12日、従三位に昇叙し、名を義輝と改める。
sen.e: On February 12th, he was upgraded to the Third Rank, and changed his name into Yoshiteru (義輝).
On February 12th, he was upgraded to the Third Rank, and changed his name to Yoshiteru (義輝).
On February 12th, he was upgraded to the Third Rank, and changed his name to Yoshiteru (義輝).
In 1565 (Eiroku 8)

sen.j: 5月19日、薨去。
sen.e: On May 19th, he died.
On May 19th, he died.
On May 19th, he died.

sen.j: 6月7日、贈従一位、太政大臣（左大臣という説もある）。
sen.e: On June 7th, he was given the First Rank and became a Daijo daijin after his death. (There is a presumption that he was given the title of Minister of the Left.)
sen.cmt: 対訳欄に左大臣を追加
sen.e: On June 7th, he was given the First Rank and became a Daijo daijin after his death. (There is a presumption that he was given the title of Minister of the Left.)
On June 7th, he was given the First Rank and became a Daijo daijin after his death. (There is a presumption that he was given the title of Minister of the Left.)

sen.j: 宮本昌孝『剣豪将軍義輝』上、中、下（徳間文庫、2000年）

sen.cmt: bunko->Bunko; これ以下の作品題名について、音訳があり、そのあと括弧の中に意訳がある。これでも良いかと思うが、意訳のみでも結構では？
